summary: A utillity to make Skyrims custom music mods more comfortable.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Arial][size=4][u][color=#ff7700]What is Custom Music Organizer?[/color]
[/u][/size][size=3]Custom Music Organizer, short CMO is a tool which purpose it is to simplify the usage of serveral custom music mods for Skyrim. It includes a graphic user interface which lets you add and remove your music files for different categories easily and copys them automaticly ,correct named into the right folders.
[/size]
[u][color=#ff7700][size=4]Features:[/size][/color][/u]
[/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=3]drag and drop support[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=3]add/remove buttons[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=3]a button to play the music file[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=3]buttons to extend all spoilers and hide them[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=3]rename already added files[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial]
[u][color=#ff7700][size=4]What it doesn't do:[/size][/color][/u]
[list]
[*][size=3]convert files to wav or xwm[/size]
[*][size=3]checks if you mixed wav and xwm files in a folder[/size]
[*][size=3]a button to set finale files (CDMS)[/size]
[/list][size=3]Most of this features are on my todo list and will be implemented some time in the future.
[/size]
[u][color=#ff7700][size=4]What you should avoid:[/size][/color][/u][list]
[*][size=3]Don't change something on the folder structure manually[/size]
[/list]
[u][size=4][color=#ff7700]Information about the file:[/color]
[/size][/u][size=3]Maybe you already noticed that CMO is a .exe file. CMO is written in Java and wrapped with Launch4j to a .exe file. That is the reason why you need to install the newest Java version. If you have serious issues about CMO being a .exe file you can click on the green tick in the download section, which will give you a virus report from serveral ant-virus programs.[/size]

[size=4][u][color=#ff7700]Currently Supported Mods:[/color]
[/u][/size][list]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13286/?]Personalized Music - Add your own music to Skyrim by No_Aardvarks_Allowed [/url][/size]
[*][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63661/?]Complete Dynamic Music System by HellLizard[/url][/size]
[/list]
[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]How to use:[/u][/size][/color]
[/font] 1. [size=3]Copy the Custom Music Organizer.exe into your Skyrim folder. [/size][font=Arial]
[/font] 2. [size=3]Create a shortcut to your desktop.[/size][font=Arial]
[/font] 3. [u][size=3]Install the cmo_config.xml file[/size][/u][font=Arial]
[/font][font=Arial][size=3][list]
[*][size=3]For Personal Music look in this mods download section.[/size]
[*][size=3]For CMDS 3.1 look on the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63661/?]CMDS[/url] download section.[/size]
[/list][/size][/font] 4. [size=3]Open CMO and add/remove music files.[/size][font=Arial]
[/font] 5. [size=3]Click on Apply to save changes.[/size][font=Arial]
[size=3]
[/size][color=#ff7700][size=4][u]How to play xmw files:
[/u][/size][/color][size=3]CMO does not play music files itself, instead it trys to open them with the windows default associated program.
Have a look at [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrim/comments/3gu57c/how_to_listen_to_xwm_in_winamp/]this[/url] post.
[/size]
[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Add Personal Music addon support:
[/u][/size][/color][size=3]To use one or more of the serveral Personal Music addons, you need to edit
the cmo_config.xml. Add a <folder name="xxx">...</folder> block in between <categories></categories> for every addon folder.
Example:
[color=#6d9eeb]<folder[/color] [color=#e06666]name[/color]=[color=#674ea7]"Example - All Soundtrack"[/color][color=#6d9eeb]>[/color]  ->[color=#f1c232]Name to display[/color]
    [color=#6d9eeb]<path[/color] [color=#e06666]value[/color]=[color=#674ea7]"Example - All"/[/color][color=#6d9eeb]>  [/color]                 ->[color=#f1c232]path to the folder beginning at "Skyrim/Data/Music/" (basicly the folder name)[/color]
    [color=#6d9eeb]<max[/color] [color=#e06666]value[/color]=[color=#674ea7]"20"[/color][color=#6d9eeb]/>[/color]                                    ->[color=#f1c232]maximal files allowed[/color]
   [color=#6d9eeb] <formatname[/color] [color=#e06666]value[/color]=[color=#674ea7]"MMExample"[/color][color=#6d9eeb]/>[/color]        ->[color=#f1c232]converts all files in this folder to MMExampleXX...[/color]
[color=#6d9eeb]</folder>[/color]
[/size]
[color=#ff7700][size=4][u]Found a bug?[/u][/size][/color]
[size=3]Please take a picture of the error message or copy and post it here and describe what you did before the bug happened.[/size]
[/font]
author: BlackoutRoulette

files.name: Custom Music Organizer.exe
files.changelogHtml:
CMO does not rename finale files anymore (CDMS)
Fixed window sizing issue when using CDMS
You now recieve a error message when you type in a non-number character in a <max value=""/> block
